verses.roman:
tāmbūla-carvita yabe kare āsvādane
ānanda-samudre ḍube, kichui nā jāne

synonyms: tāmbūla—betel nut; carvita—chewed; yabe—when; kare—does; āsvādane—tasting; ānanda-samudre—in an ocean of transcendental bliss; ḍube—drowns; kichui—anything; nā—not; jāne—knows.
translation: "When She tastes the betel chewed by Me, She merges in an ocean of joy and forgets everything else.
